alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coshocton; Harrison; Jefferson; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 15 at 10:42PM EDT until June 15 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Harrison County in east central Ohio... Northwestern Jefferson County in east central Ohio... East central Coshocton County in east central Ohio... Carroll County in east central Ohio... Tuscarawas County in east central Ohio... * Until 1115 PM EDT. * At 1041 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Waynesburg to near Dennison to 8 miles southwest of Uhrichsville to near Newcomerstown, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Uhrichsville, Cadiz, Carrollton, Freeport, Dennison, Gnadenhutten, Tuscarawas, Scio, Midvale, and Mineral City. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 66 and 79. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
